alert.note: Alert for Lebanon; Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 12:28AM EST until February 04 at 2:39PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek At Harper Tavern affecting Schuylkill and Lebanon Counties. For the Swatara Creek...including Middletown, Harper Tavern, Hershey...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. An ice jam is likely occurring on Swatara Creek. * WHERE...Swatara Creek At Harper Tavern. * WHEN...From early this morning to this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Several driveways and other minor roadways are affected. Water begins to enter some basements. At 10.0 feet, High water isolates several houses. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 9.3 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1230 PM EST.
